thread.title: Paul Prudhomme in Houston: a look back

author: chron.com
title: Paul Prudhomme in Houston: a look back
text:
Photo: John Everett, Houston Chronicle Image 1 of / 8 8 In May 1992, chef Paul Prudhomme addressed a crowd of Texas restaurant owners and managers Monday at the Southwestern Foodservice Convention & Exhibition at the George R. Brown Convention Center.
Photo: John Everett, Houston Chronicle In May 1992, chef Paul Prudhomme addressed a crowd of Texas... Image 2 of 8 In May 1992, chef Paul Prudhomme addressed a crowd of Texas restaurant owners and managers Monday at the Southwestern Foodservice Convention & Exhibition at the George R. Brown Convention Center.
Photo: John Everett, Houston Chronicle In May 1992, chef Paul Prudhomme addressed a crowd of Texas... Image 3 of 8 In May 1992, chef Paul Prudhomme addressed a crowd of Texas restaurant owners and managers Monday at the Southwestern Foodservice Convention & Exhibition at the George R. Brown Convention Center.
Photo: John Everett, Houston Chronicle In May 1992, chef Paul Prudhomme addressed a crowd of Texas... Image 4 of 8 In March 1983, chef Paul Prudhomme cooked at Brennan's of Houston. The demonstration was for delegates from the International Association of Cooking Schools convention in Houston.
Photo: Carrie Beth Tucker, Houston Chronicle In March 1983, chef Paul Prudhomme cooked at Brennan's of Houston.... Image 5 of 8 In May 1989, Chef Paul Prudhomme spoke in Houston at the annual convention of the Texas Restaurant Association.
Photo: Micheal Boddy, Houston Chronicle In May 1989, Chef Paul Prudhomme spoke in Houston at the annual... Image 6 of 8 In May 1989, chef Paul Prudhomme, assisted by his wife, K, cooked Chicken Maque Choux during a cooking demonstration at the annual convention of the Texas Restaurant Association. More than 20,000 people attended the convention at the Astrohall.
Photo: Micheal Boddy, Houston Chronicle In May 1989, chef Paul Prudhomme, assisted by his wife, K, cooked... Image 7 of 8 Chef Paul Prudhomme visited Houston in March of 1982. The specifics behind this visit are unclear.
Photo: Timothy Bullard, Houston Chronicle Chef Paul Prudhomme visited Houston in March of 1982. The specifics... Image 8 of 8 Paul Prudhomme in Houston: a look back 1 / 8 Back to Gallery Houston has a much documented culinary relationship with New Orleans. So I feel certain that I wasn't the only foodie in H-Town sad to hear of the passing of Paul Prudhomme .
I wondered too what links, if any, he had to Houston. My cursory digging didn't turn up much other than the fact that Latin Bites ' Roberto Castre worked in Prudhomme's kitchen.
The man who is credited with popularizing Cajun cuisine (and, in the process, nearly causing the extinction of redfish) did visit Houston several times during his celebrity chef hey-day.
Of course, his influence can be seen (and tasted) at Houston restaurants. (Have you tried the blackened catfish enchiladas at Danton's ?)
Prudhomme launched his career at Commander's Palace in New Orleans. When he left to open his now famous K-Paul's Louisiana Kitchen in 1982, Commander's Palace replaced him with a then-unknown Emeril Lagasse.
Another bit of trivia: Prudhomme trademarked the Turducken.
In 1989 told People magazine:
"I'd weigh 120 pounds and I'd be gorgeous and I'd be a gigolo. I love women, every kind in existence. Even women who don't like to eat because I can change their whole life in an instant. You put something in front of them that they can't stop eating, and boy, you got somebody's heart. I mean, you can start fooling around immediately - with complete power."
Check out the slideshow above to see photos of Prudhomme's visits to Houston.
